info.name: Cromanthor Refugee
info.description: The Cromanthor Refugee background from Out of the Abyss
info.author: Wizards of the Coast

description.p: You are one of hundreds of refugees that were driven from their homes after the kingdom committed itself toward the genocide of magic. Whether or not you were a magic user, had some small talent, or were simply hunted due to events relative to you, you are seen as filth towards those following the king’s propaganda. Royal guards make it very apparent at every opportunity to harass you, but should you stand up against them, you will shine like a beacon to any seeking light.

Skill Proficiencies: Nature, Survival
Tool Proficiencies: One type of artisan’s tools, Cook’s utensils
Languages: Dwarvish
Equipment: A two-person tent, artisan’s tools (one of your choice), a set of Cook’s utensils, a set of traveler’s clothes, a belt pouch, 5 gp

setters.set: Nature, Survival, Artisan’s Tool, Cook’s Utensils, Dwarvish

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I was kicked out of my home for involvement with magic, I wish not the same pain upon others around me.
The king’s guard killed someone close to me, they will fall one day, by may hand or not.
I live in the moment, knowing my life could be turned upside down any day.
I appreciate beauty in all of its forms, it can all be ruined in an instant after all.
I hate the Dwarves for their involvement in our lives.
I am a forest bumpkin who grew up in a tent in the woods and is wholly ignorant of city life.
I was raised alongside children of many other races. I harbor no racial prejudices at all.
I still occasionally mix dwarvish into sentences, from my time talking to royal guards.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Patient: The Dwarves taught me to trust those closest to me, and to doubt all others.
Rebellious: Governments and politicians drove my family to the camps. I subtly defy authority whenever I think I can get away with it. (Chaotic)
Self-Absorbed: I’ve had to look out for number one so long that it has become second nature. (Any)
Wanderlust: I want to see as much of the world beyond the camps as I can. (Any)
Generous: I give everything I can to help those in need, regardless of who they are. (Good)
To the Abyss with Them: The people of Hillsfar cast me out. I won’t risk my hide to help them. (Evil)

select.name: Bond
select.item: A Dwarf helped me despite the dangers, I will do my best to help others.
I seek revenge against the Dwarves for driving my family into the forest.
My family lost everything when they were driven from their homes. I strive to rebuild that fortune.
The forest has provided me with food and shelter. In return, I protect forests and those who dwell within.
I am deeply, tragically in love with someone whose racial lifespan is far longer or shorter than mine.
Members of my extended family did not make it to our rendezvous, I tirelessly search for them.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I am very uncomfortable indoors and underground.
I am haughty. I grew up among magical races and am used to their culture and behavior, I am awkward with social expectation.
I have an unavoidable rage towards any Dwarf I see.
I am a miser. Having lost everything once before, I clutch my possessions and wealth very tightly.
I expect nothing from others, and get very uncomfortable when offered anything, especially for free, after constant scams.
I believe the gods have cursed me, my family, and all of the refugees. We are all doomed, doomed I tell you!

description.p: You, and many like you, have suffered greatly. You bear a look of constant stress and exhaustion, though some may recognize this expression for its true meaning. Any who recognize your troubles may give you basic essentials, such as a roof for a night, or even useful information. These people are far and between, however, and you are more likely to pick up the attention of party’s associated with magic, for better or worse.
